Description:
A very cool pad in a hot location
If something a little different or quirky piques your interest, look no further than this low maintenance brick townhouse.
Ideally located just off Barnard Street and mere steps from the heart of the city, the Arts Precinct and public transport, it offers private-and -secure-but-funky living.
Keyless entry gains admission through the extended garage with remote door and room for bikes or storage.
The ground floor encompasses a compact courtyard, two bedrooms with built-in robes, three-piece bathroom, separate WC and laundry.
A timber staircase rises to the upper level where you will find the open-style living, dining and kitchen area with room for a study nook beside the stairs.
Kitchen fittings include gas cooktop, under-bench electric oven, dishwasher, ample bench space and corner pantry.
Also on this level, the main bedroom boasts a cute Juliet balcony, walk-through robe and a smart ensuite.
Notable inclusions are split system air conditioners for year-round comfort, polished concrete floors on the ground level with polished timber floorboards upstairs.
With no garden to tend, your weekends will be free for soaking up the many cultural and recreational delights in the neighbourhood.
The location is the biggie here, in minutes you can be at work in the CBD, dining at View Street cafes, watching the footy at the QEO, visiting the Art Gallery or taking in a show at the Capital or Ulumbarra Theatres.
So if a city lifestyle is your aspiration, this trendy townhouse is a great place to start. It also lends itself to use as a short or long-term rental investment.
Insights: First listed on 2 October, this house has been on Domain for 18 days. It was last sold in 2018 and 81 other 3 bedroom house in Bendigo have recently been sold.

Description:
Extend, Renovate, Develop - all with Sweeping Views of Bendigo
This address and pocket of Ironbark has quickly become one of the hottest and sought-after areas to live in Bendigo. With properties in Nettle Street fetching over 1 million dollars, this property now presents so much value and opportunity to do a multitude of things.
With a two-street frontage off Webster and Nettle streets, you could have a go at renovating this old beauty and bringing it back to life, either with an extension which is in keeping with the era, or choose a totally modern layout to suit today's busy lifestyle.
You also have the option to build your dream home (STCA) overlooking Bendigo.
What about developing the site and cash in on the rare land opportunities now in Bendigo? You could develop into two, or possibly three allotments (STCA).
This property represents arguably one of the best opportunities right now on the market.
Located just minutes and less than 2kms to Bendigo Central, Arts Precinct, Bendigo Day Surgery, St John of God Hospital, Girton Grammar and Catherine McAuley College.
Insights: First listed on 7 October, this house has been on Domain for 13 days (last updated on 7 October). It was last sold in 2019 and 5 other 4 bedroom house in Ironbark have recently been sold.

Description:
Quality craftsmanship throughout!
Located in the very popular McIvor Forest Estate, this magnificent custom-built property has been wonderfully executed by local master builder Jason Wescott. The estate offers play areas, nature reserves and easy access to the O'Keefe Rail Trail and only 9-minute' drive to the centre of Bendigo. The features of this impressive home include:
Four bedrooms, three of which have built in sliding robes with the master bedroom consisting of walk-in robe, ensuite and separate toilet
Beautifully designed and equipped kitchen along with a separate butler's pantry, storeroom and generous cupboards that would excite any budding master chef
Immaculate spotted gum timber floors, quality carpets and blinds, double glazed windows, and generous ceiling height of 2.550m
Family bathroom with separate bath, shower, and vanity
Ducted evaporative air conditioning, zoned central heating plus cosy gas log fire to snuggle up on those wintery evenings
Formal lounge and second family living area, separate study nook
Fantastic elevated, timber decked alfresco area with all-weather blinds for year-round entertaining
Double car garage plus a 9m x 6m Colorbond shed and workshop with concrete flooring, 240v power and roller doors and an additional undercover caravan/boat port
2 x 15,000 litre water tanks with pressure pump to service the extensive garden area
All services connected to the property include town water, mains natural gas, sewer, electricity and phone line
Security system for peace of mind, low maintenance and fully landscaped gardens, watering system for lawns plus side access to the private and secure rear yard
A property with so many extra inclusions inside and out, no expense spared at all, this property certainly will not disappoint upon inspection, a wow factor is assured. Do not delay, contact our office today for more information.

Description:
Original Stone Homestead the Perfect Setting - 20 acres of Prime Land
Amongst Sedgwick Valley's best with a backdrop of lush bushland, and views to the front off the verandah towards the hills, valleys and beautiful pastured land, is this approx. 30-year-old stone homestead.
Privacy from the moment you drive into the property and greeted by one of the two dams, gives you the feeling of leaving your whole day's stress and running around behind you. Original in condition inside with three bedrooms (main with ensuite), and two living areas that take in the whole glamorous outlook of the views.
One of the living areas is open plan with polished floorboards incorporating the kitchen/meals/family room.
Ducted cooling, split-system unit and inviting solid fuel heater.
Separate bathroom to the toilet and laundry which also are original. Outside is a huge powered/concreted shed measuring 7.5m x 12.5m, and a carport for vehicle accommodation. There is perfect pasture for horses and stock, and to the rear of the property is lush bushland and the second huge dam that can be accessed very easily.
Escape the hustle and bustle and create the lifestyle of the country feel you have been aching for.
10 minutes to Spring Gully and 15 minutes to Bendigo CBD.
Insights: First listed on 8 October, this house has been on Domain for 12 days (last updated on 8 October). It was last sold in 2000 and 3 other 3 bedroom house in Sedgwick have recently been sold.

Description:
A must see to appreciate this Immaculate Residence
Situated in one of Strathdales most prestigious streets this stunning brick veneer home has all the creature comforts for family living including ducted heating and cooling .
As you walk in the front door you are greeted with a spacious sunken lounge area featuring a built in bar
There is also a substantial second living area to the property that can be used as a family room and study.
Three generous size bedrooms with built in wardrobes, the main with a full ensuite and walk in robe
The kitchen boasts a large pantry with new appliances and good storage and spacious dining area.
Stepping outside is the meticulously kept landscaped garden ,the much loved property also features a large undercover alfresco area with natural gas BBQ, perfect for entertaining the family and friends as well as a workshop at the rear of the double garage .

Description:
PRETTY 12.5 ACRES PLUS CREEK LEASES & POSSESSORY RIGHTS
This is indeed a rare offering! 12.5 acres of cleared land in the bush, combined with Crown Leases on the Waanyarra Creek water frontage, a seasonal creek, and partially fenced. There is also a possessory title interest of an additional 25 acres, on which you should seek professional advice, as the claim will pass to the new owners. Escape the crowds to this quiet corner of the Goldfields, 10 minutes to Dunolly for a pie run and 40 mins to Bendigo. The block is in the Farming Zone.

Description:
Home Sweet Home!
Filled with charm, character and so much warmth this home immediately brings a smile to your face. Positioned only metres from the Epsom Train Station, Epsom shopping village, kindergartens, schools, medical centre, creek walking tracks and much more.
The property features include:
A traditional woven wire front fence and cottage garden welcomes you up to the original front decking of this charming weatherboard home, with an approximate build year of 1926. The home has been lovingly cared for over many years and now restored to a glorious standard
As you step through the front door the striking original polished floor boards are breathtaking, with a large open plan living area leading to the impressive modern kitchen with 900m electric oven, gas cooktop, Smeg dishwasher, ample bench space plus large walk in pantry
Four huge bedrooms in total, master bedroom with large modern ensuite with walk in shower, vanity unit and toilet, plus a walk-in robe
The other two bedrooms offer sizeable walk in robes also with the fourth without a robe but of significant size for home office/study or alike
Central bathroom with vanity, shower and toilet
Ducted gas heating and ducted evaporative cooling throughout
A formal dining area leads to the charming sunroom fully enclosed with magnificent northerly aspect and elevated views over the lush back yard
Step outside to the back yard which is filled with aged established trees ready to blossom, lush lawns, a 7m x 6m (approx.) shed at the rear of yard, secure Colorbond fencing on three boundaries plus a hand laid brick path
Double garage measuring approx. 8m x 6.5m with concrete floor, power and shelving
Other features to mention:
In the many years the current custodians have called this delightful property home, the following works have been undertaken
Restumping, rewiring, reroofing, replumbing, painted internally and externally, updated and restored features throughout
If you are looking for that home sweet home, this one might just be it?! Enquire today to book your private inspection.

Description:
Location and Potential close to Bendigo CBD
Don't let 188 Mackenzie Street be the one that got away.
This home is oozing with potential and location appeal.
Either add to the investment portfolio, bring in a rental income or invest, refresh and occupy for yourself; this home has plenty of potential to make it your own.
The biggest drawcard? The location!
Take a five-minute walk to Golden Square Woolworths, nearby shops, amenities, schools, day cares and St John of God hospital, or take a quick car trip into Bendigo CBD - the location is absolutely ideal.
Featuring high ceilings with pine panelling, dado boards, adjoining brick fireplace with mantle in the living and kitchen, a spacious light filled bedroom, separate kitchen and dining, main bathroom with ornate features and laundry at the back of the house. Refurbishing and updating would be idyllic with its floor plan and original fittings creating the perfect foundations to bring this abode into the modern era while still highlighting its character.
Two 3m by 3m sheds and a secure backyard adds to its appeal.
Arrange your inspection before it's too late.

Description:
History Meets Idyllic Lifestyle Living
An elegant and luxurious stunner right in the heart of the city.
This modern-meets-charming home offers high end finishes throughout, a stylish kitchen with striking island bench, designer bathroom, spacious bedrooms and flowing living spaces with plenty of awe-inspiring moments.
Walking up the inviting brick footpath and through the feature leadlight front door you'll instantly feel the luxurious vibe as you step onto the new timber flooring.
The two bedrooms at the front of the home are complete with built-in robes and ornate features. The third bedroom has the opportunity to be turned into an ensuite if you wish.
At the end of the hall peer into the newly refurbished bathroom; stunning floor to ceiling designer tiling, claw foot bath and an eye-catching ornate vanity making up its highlights. The kitchen beautifully combines contemporary styling with classic features including an impressive timber island bench with built-in storage. Marble benchtops, quality stainless appliances and walk-in pantry adds to this room's features.
Maintain the climate all year round thanks to the home's multiple split systems and cosy gas log fireplace. Your fourth bedroom is off the lounge room and also offers a built-in robe.
Step through double French doors and you are greeted by your private and secure split-level backyard showcasing an undercover carport and barbecue area, and a 6m x 6m concreted double garage with additional off-street parking along your asphalt driveway.
Imagine being able to walk into town to grab a coffee, meet a friend or absorb all the cultural offerings Bendigo has to offer right at your doorstep. The location is absolutely idyllic.

Description:
GET AWAY
Imagine owning 22 acres, 8.5 hectares (approx) of rolling countryside. Under an hour from Bendigo (only 2 hours from Melbourne CBD). Leave your troubles behind & relax. Retire & breath in the fresh air. Build your holiday home or your castle. Far, far away (but not too far). Escape & write your own novel, look out at the ever changing scenery. Park the caravan. Tend to your animals. Zoned; Rural Conservation. Endless potential. Limited only by your imagination, budget & Council approval. Dare to dream.
COVID-19 and OPEN FOR INSPECTIONS - We are committed to the health and safety of our clients, and the general public so please note that where there are no inspection times listed you can contact the agent directly to arrange a Private Inspection. We can also provide alternatives to meeting in person.

Description:
Family home with all the extras!
Positioned in a quiet family friendly court, within metres of Strathfieldsaye Central and all it has to offer, St Francis of the Fields Primary School, creek side walking tracks, sporting facilities and plenty more. This location is arguably one of most convenient family lifestyle locations of Strathfieldsaye!
Built by local builder Andrew Ralph (Hotondo Homes Bendigo) in 2013, this large family home boasts four bedrooms plus a dedicated home office/study and three separate living areas
Master bedroom with walk through robe, large ensuite with spacious shower and separate toilet
Front formal lounge room adjacent to the home office/study
Open plan galley kitchen with gas cooktop, electric oven, dishwasher, walk in pantry and breakfast bar, ample cupboard and bench space
A large dining area adjoins the kitchen with light filled windows overlooking the large landscaped yard, complete with in ground salt chlorinated, electric heated pool with glass panel and tubular fencing
Ducted gas heating and ducting evaporative cooling throughout
The north facing wing of the home comprises of three more spacious bedrooms all with built in robes, a large bathroom with shower, vanity, bath and separate toilet. Complementing this end of the home is a kid's rumpus living zone with direct access sliding doors to outside
Step outside to the spacious yard with magnificent landscaping, established trees, shrubs, strong retaining walls, veggie garden and lush lawn area
Make your way up to the elevated, covered pool hut with decking and adjoining 4m x 4m Colorbond storage shed/art studio with power and concrete floor
A 3-kilowatt solar system with 12 panels on regular tariff, plus solar hot water with gas back up system
The north west corner of the yard offers a fun and secure chook house, timber throne sculpture, 3m x 3m garden shed, raised garden bed vegetable patch and a family fire pit area
The back yard has vehicle access along the west side of the house through decorative double steel gates. The front street entry is private and tree lined with a bitumen driveway leading into a double automatic garage with direct access inside the home
All the hard work is done here, added extras everywhere you look, this home offers fantastic family living so close to central Strathfieldsaye and nicely positioned on a whopping 1106m2 land allotment. A true hidden gem be very quick to enquire on this one!!

Description:
AS GOOD AS BRAND NEW!
Located in popular Strathfieldsaye in a newly established boutique estate is this 6 month old family home that is ready for you to move your furniture in and call it home. With such a tight squeeze on vacant land and most builders booked out until next year, why bother with the frustration of building when you own a custom built, quality home in time for the New Year!
With that "new home smell" still evident throughout, the home is as good as brand new. Presented beautifully and fitted with all the modern fixtures and fittings on the inside, and fully landscaped and manicured on the outside, there is literally nothing left for you to do
The floor plan will ideally suit a young family or a retiree equally well, making it appealing to a wide range of quality home seekers! Featuring four big sized bedrooms, two with built in robes, one with walk in robe and the spacious master with walk in robe and ensuite. The family bathroom lies in close proximity to the kids/guest bedrooms, with a full sized laundry tucked away cleverly off the kitchen and a full storage room lies off the central living space. Split system heating and cooling and control the temperature, as well as ceiling fans in each bedroom. Two separate living spaces are positioned at either end of the home, allowing flexibility to cater for each householders needs. There is plenty of dining space afforded for a large table setting to house Christmas lunch at your new home this year! The galley style kitchen has all the mod cons, and plenty of room to move. There is excellent cupboard and bench space, dishwasher, and new cooking appliances!
Outside, the 603m2 (approx) corner allotment provides the all important and coveted side access from Vellore Way ideal to gain vehicle access or off street parking for a caravan or trailer. A double garage with internal access lies at the front for secure car parking. There is an existing garden shed for storage, but the space will allow you to construct a bigger shed if you desire. The space afforded on the block has been well utilised. The front and rear have been freshly turfed and gardens edged and planted leaving a relatively low maintenance yard to look after. The outdoor area will be awesome for relaxing or entertaining in the upcoming summer months.
Don't wait for land or a builder when you have everything here already waiting for you. Available in time for a new year, what a fantastic way to start it off after such a dire 2020. Call now to inspect by private appointment.

Description:
A LIFESTYLE WORTH LIVING!
Nestled amongst the gently undulating backdrop of beautiful Lockwood South, this superb lifestyle property set on 8 picturesque acres will have those looking for an escape to the country genuinely excited! Located approx. 15 minutes from the centre of Bendigo, the peace and quiet of a laid back country lifestyle is assured, with the convenience and amenities of a major regional city within short a reach
With an air of familiarity surrounding most new builds on the market these days, it's nice to come across something that is a little unique that bucks the trend. Individually designed and built by a renowned local builder, the home has been well positioned to provide many lovely vantage points (both inside and out) of the landscape beyond. Boasting approx. 42 squares under roof, a family will thrive with room to move and space to grow! Notable features include double glazed windows, 5kw solar panel system, split system heating/cooling, solid fuel heating (with duct to upstairs), access to bore water (@30L per minute), and 50,000L of tank water storage
The floor plan will provide the new owner will plenty of flexibility and a great family home. Featuring five large bedrooms, all have celling fans and built in robes whilst the huge master suite has its own ensuite and walk in robe. The main bathroom downstairs has both shower and bath and adjoining powder room. Upstairs has a large living retreat with glass sliding doors opening on to a decked balcony, a perfect spot to take in the morning sun or sunset views on warm evenings. There are two large living spaces downstairs, including the original garage which has been converted to a huge rumpus room/home office. The other is the family room which forms part of the spacious open plan kitchen/dining and living zone, where most of your daily interaction will occur. The meals area affords plenty of space for a big feature dining table, whilst the kitchen has been fitted with all the mod cons and is as up to date now as the day it was built! Offering an abundance of bench and cupboard space, features include 900mm cooking facilities, dishwasher and stone bench tops to name a few. Completing the internal layout is the big laundry with plenty of storage, a feature throughout the home
Externally, the property offers equally as many talking points. A private tree lined driveway is accessed from both Hamilton Way and Bendigo-Maldon Road. There are existing paddocks in place with electric fencing and troughs available for a pony for the kids, or other animals to keep the grass down. A recently constructed 3 bay garage/shed is ideal for car/caravan or boat storage, and has roller door access, extra tall middle bay, concrete floor and power. At the rear is a lean to which is great for wood storage or a trailer/boat. There is a dam towards the bottom of the block that is full and has excellent catchment, whilst a bore on the property produces 30L of water per minute to assist with irrigation and other water needs.
If a move to the more relaxed and gentle pace of the country is on the cards, then this is your point of difference. Properties like these are not available to own every day, making this a highly desirable place to reside. Come and get a feel for what its like to breathe the country air and call today to inspect

Description:
Solid family home on massive block!
Positioned in the ever popular and family friendly neighborhood of Maiden Gully and situated on a huge 6,385 Sqm block (approximately) a property of such large proportions with endless amounts of possibilities and opportunities rarely comes to market. Suitable to a wide range of buyers from varying size families to investor/developers, this cracking property is not to be missed!
Located only a short 4 minute drive to Maiden Gully Shops, Primary School, Early Learning Centre/kindergarten and Marist College, as well a brief 10 minute drive to the centre of Bendigo this property offers a lifestyle with plenty of space for the whole family whilst being able to enjoy everything you need at your doorstep.
The 25 year old brick home presents in well looked after original condition and features three well sized bedrooms and separate study. Each bedroom is finished with generous built in robes and enjoys a good amount of natural light throughout the year. The master, bedroom two and the study can all be found at the front of the home, the layout then flows seamlessly onto the heart of the home, the open plan kitchen, living and dining space. This area is well proportioned throughout and offers a convenient floor plan for ideal livability. The classic timber kitchen has plenty of bench and storage space as well as a free standing gas oven & stove cook-top. Moving further down the house you will find bedroom three and large updated bathroom with walk in shower, single vanity and toilet.
Additional accommodation is also supplied by the property's large separate dwelling/bungalow which is postioned further down the block. This is completed with a kitchenette and reverse cycle air conditioner, lending itself to present as an ideal teenagers retreat, separate office or even extra storage space!
Outside the home you are sure to fall in love with the established gardens and endless amount of space for the kids or pets and animals to run around and enjoy the perks of living on your very own 1 1/2 acre allotment. The house is supplied with town water whilst watering and garden maintenance is assisted perfectly by the property's six rain water tanks which hold a total of 73,000 litres and service the entire garden using a single pump and a 2 x 8 station automatic irrigation system.
All your storage and car accommodation needs are covered thanks to the properties large garage sized shed with concrete flooring and single phase power as well as the expansive triple bay carport which comes off the left hand side of the house. There are also three additional garden sheds for any further storage space required. The property also features a newly installed 5.6 Kw Solar system which helps to keep the bills minimal throughout majority of the year.
Coming to market for the first time in the last 23 years 458 Olympic Parade is a rare home and opportunity that is not to be missed, don't miss out on your chance to secure this amazing Maiden Gully property, inquire today!
Please note the following items will not be included in the sale:
Some of the Rose bushes throughout the garden (can be specified on request)
The fountain in the garden to the right of the house (viewable from the kitchen window).
The wall fountain in the carport.
Magnolia.
Lilac.
The bird cage.
All the garden furniture and ornaments.
Security System x 2 (1 x House, 1 x Bungalow).
